newsitem.title: USA: PRESS DIGEST - Daily Variety - June 17.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Daily Variety - June 17.

text.p: The following stories appeared in Tuesday's Daily Variety:
* NBC's "3rd Rock From the Sun" is poised to top the $100 million mark in off-network syndication license fees.

* Warner Village Cinemas, a joint venture between Warner Bros. International Theaters and Australia's Village Roadshow International plans to build a $56 million, 32-screen theater at London's abandoned Battersea Power Station.

* British Telecommunications Plc's broadcast services is expected to announce Tuesday that London-based production houses will soon have a high-speed digital link to Los Angeles that will allow Soho-based media companies to play a bigger role in the special effects and post-production marketplace.
* Actors Ron Eldard and Justine Bateman are expected to depart the NBC sitcom "Men Behaving Badly" shortly after the start of its second season.
* Consumers over 35 are buying records in surprisingly large numbers, a shift from tradition in which 14-to-24-year-old dominated record buying.
* Director Penny Marshall has agreed to develop "Saving Grace" and may direct the at Seagram Co Ltd's Universal Studios.
* China now has its first national cinema chain: Zhonghua Theaters.
